citation.title: Mutations in FAM20C are associated with lethal osteosclerotic bone dysplasia (Raine syndrome), highlighting a crucial molecule in bone development.

reference.scope: VARIANTS RNS ARG-379; GLU-379; ARG-388 AND TRP-549

comment.text: Golgi serine/threonine protein kinase that phosphorylates secretory pathway proteins within Ser-x-Glu/pSer motifs and plays a key role in biomineralization of bones and teeth (PubMed:22582013, PubMed:23754375, PubMed:25789606). Constitutes the main protein kinase for extracellular proteins, generating the majority of the extracellular phosphoproteome (PubMed:26091039). Mainly phosphorylates proteins within the Ser-x-Glu/pSer motif, but also displays a broader substrate specificity (PubMed:26091039). Phosphorylates casein as well as a number of proteins involved in biomineralization such as AMELX, AMTN, ENAM and SPP1 (PubMed:22582013, PubMed:25789606). In addition to its role in biomineralization, also plays a role in lipid homeostasis, wound healing and cell migration and adhesion (PubMed:26091039).
Serine/threonine protein kinase activity is increased upon interaction with FAM20A.
Interacts with FAM20A; probably forming a heterotetramer of 2 subunits of FAM20A and 2 subunits of FAM20C.

disease.name: Raine syndrome
disease.description: Autosomal recessive osteosclerotic bone dysplasia with neonatal lethal outcome. Clinical features include generalized osteosclerosis, craniofacial dysplasia and microcephaly.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.

property.value: Regulation of Insulin-like Growth Factor (IGF) transport and uptake by Insulin-like Growth Factor Binding Proteins (IGFBPs)
Expressed in parotid gland and 206 other tissues
F:phosphotransferase activity, alcohol group as acceptor
P:regulation of fibroblast growth factor receptor signaling pathway

feature.description: In RNS; mild non-lethal form; decreased protein kinase activity; dbSNP:rs778899041.
In RNS; mild non-lethal form; decreased protein kinase activity; FAM20A is still able to increase remaining protein kinase activity; dbSNP:rs797044462.
In RNS; mild non-lethal form; decreased protein kinase activity.
Does not affect secretion or activity.
Impaired secretion; when associated with A-335 and A-470.
Impaired secretion; when associated with A-101 and A-470.
Impaired secretion; when associated with A-101 and A-335.
Unable to bind manganese; abrogates kinase activity.
